title: How to Sell Furniture

parts.name: Finding a Place to List Sales

steps.headline: List the furniture through online marketplaces or apps.
steps.description: Community-based websites are the best places to show off your furniture. Try using a site like Craigslist, Letgo, or Nextdoor. These websites enable your advertisement to reach people within your community. It’s the easiest way to advertise to a wide audience. You can list furniture on a few sites to increase the chances of making a sale. For instance, you might write, “Selling an oak dresser with minor scratches on the top but otherwise in good condition. It is 3 years old and used moderately to store clothing.”

steps.headline: Post an advertisement to social media.
steps.description: Make a couple of posts on your profile pages explaining what you have for sale and how much it costs. Also, look for community groups in your area. Some social media platforms also have online marketplaces you can use to list your furniture. Focus on pages for communities in your immediate vicinity. You are more likely to sell to someone who doesn’t have to travel far to retrieve the furniture. Look for groups made for buying and selling things. Many areas have groups like this to help people get in touch with one another. Try posting something like, “Is anyone interested in a mahogany wardrobe? It has been sitting in a spare bedroom and hasn’t been used the past 2 years.”

steps.headline: Make flyers to post on community boards in your area.
steps.description: Apartment complexes, community centers, offices, and some businesses have community boards. Type up a clear, colorful ad on a computer, then print it out on basic printer paper. Make copies to pin up around town. Anyone walking by could be the buyer you’re looking for. Always ask for permission before hanging up your advertisement. Contact the business or person in charge of the community board. You could up the flyer to say, “Living room set for sale, purchased in 2017 and gently used.. It is made with a firm black vinyl that has no noticeable damage.”

steps.headline: Take the furniture to a reseller if you need to make a quick sale.
steps.description: Consignment stores offer a place for you to put your furniture on display. The store takes a percentage of the money you get from the sale. Check out used furniture stores if you’re looking to sell to a retailer. You could also try antique stores if you’re trying to get rid of antique furniture. Antique and used furniture stores often have an appraiser who can tell you how much your furniture is worth. They buy the furniture from you and may give you a better deal if you deliver it to the store on your own. Consignment stores pay you when the furniture sells. It’s a good way to show off furniture without having it take up space in your home.

steps.headline: Sell your furniture at a garage or estate sale if you’re having one.
steps.description: Host a garage sale in your yard to get rid of furniture and all sorts of other goods. Sales are a great option if you have a lot of things to sell. You will need to put the furniture in a visible spot, but good pieces often sell quickly at these sorts of events. One downside of a sale is that only people who live near you may visit. You could also post ads online to ensure more people see the furniture you are selling. An estate sale is a good option if you’re trying to clear out a home, such as one from a deceased family member. For instance, you might have a dining room set to sell. Put a picture of the set on the flyer and write, “Cherry dining set with minor chips. Includes a table and 4 upholstered chairs for $500.”

steps.headline: Post an ad in the newspaper to reach more people in your community.
steps.description: Newspapers are still useful for advertising sales. Contact the printing company in your area, then give them an ad listing the furniture you are selling. Include a picture to increase the chances of a sale. Newspaper ads cost money according to the size and number of words used, so discuss the pricing before you pay. Newspaper ads are a good way to advertise inside your community, but keep in mind that it targets a limited audience. Many people look for furniture online. Newspaper ads have to be kept short in most cases. Type something like, “Red leather armchair for sale. Has some small cracks but well-kept, asking price $250.”

steps.headline: Clean the furniture before trying to advertise.
steps.description: The furniture is the star of your ad, so make it look good. Give it a thorough dusting or vacuuming to remove any debris settled upon it. Then, wash off stains by scrubbing with soap and water or a furniture polish. Also, take apart as much of the furniture as possible to clean out the insides. For example, take the drawers out of a dresser and pull the cushions off the couch. It helps with making the furniture look better, but it also ensures you don’t leave anything valuable behind. Some damage is normal with used furniture. You don’t have to try fixing or cleaning permanent damage. Sell the furniture as is.

steps.headline: Take quality pictures of the furniture.
steps.description: Make sure the furniture looks clean and doesn’t have any clutter near it. Also, set up some good lighting so the pictures are as clear as you can make them. Once you’re ready to start snapping photos, capture the furniture at a few different angles. Let potential buyers see the pictures so they can get an idea of what you’re selling, even if they aren’t able to see it in person. Take clear pictures of chips, stains, and other problems so potential buyers know what they are getting. Increase the chances of a sale by staging the furniture in your home. Make it look like a display at a store. It gives buyers more clarity about the size and decor style.

steps.headline: Show everything that is included in a furniture set.
steps.description: If you’re selling a dining room table and chairs, for example, pose them together in at least one photo. To avoid confusion, separate furniture you aren't selling as a bundle. Your advertisement should clearly display what you plan on selling. Keep in mind that online buyers often click through ads until they notice a good picture. If your photo is confusing, you may have a hard time selling or end up with people who don’t misunderstand what you’re selling. Furniture sets have to be listed together in the same ad. If you show off a couch but don’t let people see the rest of the living room set, then you won’t get as many interested buyers.

steps.headline: Write a simple but accurate description that covers what you’re selling.
steps.description:
The description should be short and to the point. List the important details about the furniture, such as the year it was made, how it was used, and what condition it is in. The description needs to be as honest as you can make it in order to entice buyers to consider what you’re selling. For example, you might write, “I am moving and need to sell my black leather ottoman. It was purchased new in 2015 and used in the living room, but pets were not allowed on it.”
Look online to see if you can find more information about what you’re selling. Check the manufacturer’s website for listings, then post a link if you’re able to find one.

steps.headline: Select a fair price you expect to receive from the sale.
steps.description: The price will depend on many factors, particularly the condition of the furniture. Generally, 70% to 80% of the purchase price is a fair starting rate for used furniture. Subtract another 5% for every year you have owned the furniture. Also, lower your asking price to compensate for marks, dings, and other wear and tear. If you’re unsure what price to set, look around online to see if you can find similar furniture for sale. Keep in mind that antiques and items made from sturdy materials are worth more than cheap furniture. Consider calling an antique store to ask for an appraiser’s opinion on the price.

steps.headline: Include your phone number or other contact information.
steps.description: Select a way for potential buyers to get in touch with you. For online ads, leaving your email address is fine, although you could also give out your phone number. If you’re posting the ad around your community, calling or texting will most likely be easier. Leave your contact information underneath the description. It doesn’t have to be printed in big letters, but it needs to be recognizable.

steps.headline: Negotiate if you are unable to sell the furniture right away.
steps.description: Sometimes, buyers offer less than what you want to get for your furniture. Prepare for this by coming up with a few basic responses. One of the most common tactics is to drop your asking price a little more to get the buyer to agree to a deal. If you’re not in a hurry to sell, you could reject offers to wait for one you like. Take into account your situation. When you’re in a hurry to move, for instance, you may have no choice but to get rid of furniture as soon as possible by accepting a lower offer. Once you agree to a price, stick to it. Don’t change it when the buyer shows up, but also don’t sell to someone demanding that you lower the price.

steps.headline: Choose a safe place to meet up to transfer the furniture.
steps.description: You may need to sell the furniture from your home. In that case, invite the buyer over on a day when you’re not home alone. Make sure they are prepared to pay for and transport the furniture before you let them in. Have the furniture ready to be moved, such as by putting it in the front room of your home. If you’re able to move the furniture yourself, you could choose to meet the buyer somewhere public, such as a parking lot. It could be a good choice if you don’t want anyone in your home or want to meet the buyer halfway.

steps.headline: Find a way to transfer the furniture to the buyer.
steps.description: If you’re selling from your home, it is usually the buyer’s responsibility to retrieve the furniture. You may need to help them carry the furniture out to a moving vehicle. If you’re taking the furniture somewhere, such as a consignment shop, fit it into your vehicle carefully to avoid chips, tears, or other spots of damage. The easiest way to ensure the furniture doesn’t get damaged is by borrowing a big van or moving truck. You may be able to fit some furniture into a smaller vehicle and then hold the trunk closed with bungee cords.

text:

It is 3 years old and used moderately to store clothing.” Post an advertisement to social media. Make a couple of posts on your profile pages explaining what you have for sale and how much it costs. You are more likely to sell to someone who doesn’t have to travel far to retrieve the furniture. Look for groups made for buying and selling things. Many areas have groups like this to help people get in touch with one another. Try posting something like, “Is anyone interested in a mahogany wardrobe? It has been sitting in a spare bedroom and hasn’t been used the past 2 years.” Make flyers to post on community boards in your area. Contact the business or person in charge of the community board. You could up the flyer to say, “Living room set for sale, purchased in 2017 and gently used.. It is made with a firm black vinyl that has no noticeable damage.” Take the furniture to a reseller if you need to make a quick sale. Consignment stores offer a place for you to put your furniture on display. The store takes a percentage of the money you get from the sale. Check out used furniture stores if you’re looking to sell to a retailer. You could also try antique stores if you’re trying to get rid of antique furniture. Antique and used furniture stores often have an appraiser who can tell you how much your furniture is worth. They buy the furniture from you and may give you a better deal if you deliver it to the store on your own. Consignment stores pay you when the furniture sells. It’s a good way to show off furniture without having it take up space in your home. Sell your furniture at a garage or estate sale if you’re having one. You will need to put the furniture in a visible spot, but good pieces often sell quickly at these sorts of events. One downside of a sale is that only people who live near you may visit. You could also post ads online to ensure more people see the furniture you are selling. An estate sale is a good option if you’re trying to clear out a home, such as one from a deceased family member. For instance, you might have a dining room set to sell. Put a picture of the set on the flyer and write, “Cherry dining set with minor chips. Newspaper ads have to be kept short in most cases. Type something like, “Red leather armchair for sale. Has some small cracks but well-kept, asking price $250.” Creating a Sales Ad Clean the furniture before trying to advertise. The furniture is the star of your ad, so make it look good. Give it a thorough dusting or vacuuming to remove any debris settled upon it. Then, wash off stains by scrubbing with soap and water or a furniture polish. It helps with making the furniture look better, but it also ensures you don’t leave anything valuable behind. Some damage is normal with used furniture. You don’t have to try fixing or cleaning permanent damage. Sell the furniture as is. Take quality pictures of the furniture. Make sure the furniture looks clean and doesn’t have any clutter near it. Also, set up some good lighting so the pictures are as clear as you can make them. Once you’re ready to start snapping photos, capture the furniture at a few different angles. Let potential buyers see the pictures so they can get an idea of what you’re selling, even if they aren’t able to see it in person. If you show off a couch but don’t let people see the rest of the living room set, then you won’t get as many interested buyers. List the important details about the furniture, such as the year it was made, how it was used, and what condition it is in. For example, you might write, “I am moving and need to sell my black leather ottoman. It was purchased new in 2015 and used in the living room, but pets were not allowed on it.”
Look online to see if you can find more information about what you’re selling. Check the manufacturer’s website for listings, then post a link if you’re able to find one. If you’re not in a hurry to sell, you could reject offers to wait for one you like. Take into account your situation.
